nodes.text: According to the precepts of our Headmaster, the best way to motivate students to learn is to pit all of you against one another in a competition to see who is the 'best'.
You will all be vying for the coveted title of 'Rogue of the Year.' No doubt you are all drooling with anticipation at the mere thought of attaining such a prize.
You will be judged upon your participation in the classroom and your mastery of Rogue Skills as well as your actions throughout the course of this semester.
You will be judged by your peers in this class as well as by myself. I trust you are all now spurred to greatness by the mere thought of such an honor.

nodes.name: Year of the Rogue
nodes.description: There's a competition for Rogue of the Year. As long as Sosi doesn't win, who cares? Oh.. and Master von Urwald is good with throwing daggers. We're all supposed to practice tossing daggers.

nodes.text: Herr Sosi, who do you believe will win this competition?
I will be the one to earn the title of the Rogue of the Year, Master.
Fräulein MacMichael, who do you believe will win?
I will.
Herr Kent - who will win?
I will do my best to win, sir.
Fräulein Esme, who will win?
Katie, sir. I think she's best of all.
It seems that you have your first advocate, Fräulein MacMichael. Congratulations.
Herr Kyro, who do you believe will win?
Caesari will.
You are already quite skilled in Rogue skills, Herr Kyro. I am surprised that you do not intend to compete.
It is just, sir, that I think that Caesari will work harder to be the Rogue of the Year.

nodes.message: We know how Joel feels; this shows how Caesari feels.
nodes.commentor: Master -> Caesari next comment is not an error.

nodes.text: You are undoubtedly correct.
Herr O'Conner, who do you think will win this competition?
I will.
You have a slight disadvantage already, being the newcomer. However, you do have some slight potential.
It will take brains, skill, charm, and actions to win this competition. O'Conner doesn't have a chance.
We shall see, shall we?
Caesari Sosi will win.
I did not see you as the follower, mein Herr. Interesting.
I think that Katie will win.
Ah, Fräulein MacMichael, you have charmed another to your side.
I think that Thomas will win this competition.
Ah, Herr Kent, it seems that someone else has confidence in your abilities.
Thank you, Shawn.
I think that Esme will be Rogue of the Year.
It seems that you have an admirer, Fräulein Esme.
I think Joel Kyro could be Rogue of the Year.
So, Herr Kyro, perhaps you, too, could win this competition if you but had confidence in your own abilities.
I encourage all of you to strive for the title, regardless of its meaninglessness. We shall see if this motivates you to overcome your lazy tendencies.
Today's practice session should be on dagger throwing. It's amazing how useful a well-placed dagger can be.
Class dismissed.
